intro: Elatostema rostratum var. manillense, commonly known as the Manilla Elatostema, is a flowering plant species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle and related plants. The plant is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany and ecological research.
